intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium paltinae subsp. alexandri-borzae, commonly known as the Alexandrian-Borza hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and yellowish to brownish flowers, which are arranged in a disc-like structure. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
